skipjack homecoming captain jeanluc picard had forgotten what a quiet corridor sounded like the enterprised normally a symphony of purposeful footsteps gentle chatter and the subtle hum of systems running at peak condition now felt strangely hollow the ship had returned to earth for an extensive refiteverything from structural reinforcements to new warp coil articulatorspart of starfleets desperate effort to keep its best vessels in the fight against the dominion the war had stretched the fleet thin and maintenance docks across the system were overloaded beyond anything the corps of engineers had ever seen everywhere picard turned someone in a jumpsuit rushed past carrying parts schematics and containers of conduit plasma techs darted into jefferies tubes like startled animals angry voices and clanging tools echoed through the ship it was controlled chaos and for once the crew wasnt part of it most of them were goneat least temporarily given the long wait for a repair berth starfleet had authorized nearuniversal shore leave crewmen who hadnt set foot on earth in years disappeared the moment they got clearance families reunited people slept in their own beds for the first time in half a decade even the transporter rooms had lines transporter rooms picard thought amused there was something poetic about a galaxyclass starship stuck in a queue like an impatient traveler at an airport the shuttle bays werent any better the captains personal shuttlethe one usually waiting for him with immaculate punctualityhad been rerouted to assist with some emergency priority project on mars something about experimental engine diagnostics the war created endless priorities and the enterprise wasnt currently one of them all of that combined to leave even him in a logistical limbo jeanluc picard explorer diplomat veteran starship commander waiting for a ride but then came the offer hed barely stepped out of the turbolift when commander sternan overworked underrested engineering liaisonpractically ambushed him captain picard sir you uh youre on the special authorization list picard arched a brow am i yes sir for the skipjack he blinked the what a new shortrange experimental personnel transporter shuttle they need someone with commandlevel clearance to test longdistance stability picard hesitated and what type of experience should i expect on this skipjack stern winced its a compact design compact turned out to be quite an understatement the skipjack was docked in a small tethered bay jutting off the temporary scaffolding of utopia planitias outer ring it was sleek yespicard would give it thatbut sleek in the way a fish was sleek narrow bulletshaped barely large enough inside for the pilot two mission operators and picard wedged behind them in something that could only charitably be called a seat the interior smelled faintly of new wiring and fresh plastics and something else something sharp and metallic the pilot ensign harlow grinned back at him a little too enthusiastically for picards taste welcome aboard the skipjack sir youre our first nonengineering passenger that picard said dryly does not surprise me dont worry about the noise harlow added tapping rapidly at the controls shes stable stable the word echoed ominously in the captains mind the moment they launched he understood why the crew was so eager to reassure him the skipjack didnt fly so much as lurch forward like a startled animal the engines emitted a series of sharp wet phtphtpht sounds as if the ship were repeatedly sneezing picard grabbed the nearest support bar before he could pitch sideways what in gods name is that sound he demanded over the commline thats normal harlow shouted back the phasedcompression coils spit plasma during microjumps picard stared at the back of the ensigns head wonderingnot for the first time in his lifewhether early retirement would truly be so terrible the skipjack didnt travel by sustained warp instead it performed a rapidfire sequence of microwarp bursts each lasting less than a second it felt like being pulled forward by invisible hooks over and over again the stars outside flickered violently between each skip but the truththe embarrassing truth he would never admit to anyone least of all will rikerwas that it was exhilarating the little ship clawed its way through space with reckless enthusiasm like a shuttle refusing to believe it was limited by physics each burst of acceleration shoved him firmly back in his seat each staccato pop of the engines felt like the universe coughing around them it was messy chaotic and undignified it was the most fun hed had in months harlow turned halfway toward him somewhere around jupiter doing okay back there sir i am managing picard replied fighting the urge to grin earth greeted him like an old friend the skipjack dropped out of its final skip and glided toward the atmosphere quiet at last paris glimmered on the horizon the curvature of the planet wrapped beneath them in a comforting sweep of oceans and continents picard found himself relaxing for the first time since before the war began no padds no tactical briefings no casualty reports no political negotiations just the thought of the warm breeze drifting through his vineyards brushing the tops of the grape vines the same way he had done since his childhood the shuttle touched down near his familys estate with a gentle hiss safe and smooth harlow announced proudly picard gave him a look i will charitably accept the word safe as for smooth i believe we were on different vessels harlow laughed nervously it uh grows on you to picards own surprise it had he stepped out into the warm air of la barre the scent hit him immediatelysoil sunlight ripened fruit a grounded stubborn earth smell that no holodeck had ever managed to replicate he closed his eyes for a moment letting the breeze carry away weeks of tension he could hear his brothers voice in the distance shouting instructions about a mechanical harvester old equipment groaned and chirped workers laughed as they loaded baskets it was home and yet the thought drifted back to the skipjack the ridiculous little machine with its sputtering coils and undignified jolts he had loathed it the moment he stepped aboard but somewhere between utopia planitia and earth a part of him had rediscovered something hed been missing thrill not the solemn thrill of diplomacy or the structured thrill of commanding a starship but the simple unrefined joy of motion of going somewhere fast simply because you could the war had stripped so much from the galaxy but somehow this cramped spitting metal bullet had given him a tiny piece of wonder back he would never say that aloud not even under oath a week later when it came time to return to the enterprise he found himself lingering at the vineyard a little longer than usual watching the sun cut golden lines through the rows of vines his family insisted he take a few extra bottles back with him his nephew pestered him for stories his brother attemptedunsuccessfullyto convince him to abandon starfleet and return to a real life but duty called and picard answered the skipjack awaited him once more ensign harlow smiled ready for another ride captain picard stepped aboard with measured dignity ensign lets try not to tear a hole in subspace this time no promises sir the engines spooled up the first phtphtpop shook the cabin picard braced himself and thenvery quietly very privatelyhe smiled for all its flaws this absurd little ship could do what few things in his life still could it surprised him and in wartime surprises were in short supply he settled into the cramped rear seat straightened his uniform and prepared himself for the barrage of microjumps ahead take us home ensign the skipjack spat shuddered and leapt skyward and jeanluc picardcaptain diplomat explorerlet himself enjoy every ridiculous second of the ride

a new subdifferent focus but thats what we need in order to avoid getting banned im excited to announce a new discussion space ive created its not a repeat of anything prior this community is focused on exploring the broader landscape of influencer culture influencers who prioritize aesthetics over safety social media ethics and water safety it will also discuss monetizing children using grief as a means to grift etc well be having thoughtful conversations about public figures and accountability we just cant have a duplicate sub to those that have been banned so we can still discuss our fav influencers in a broader landscape while we can and will touch on specific cases and individuals including some you might be familiar with or have heard of the scope here is intentionally broad think of this as a place for analyzing social media trends and their impacts discussing safety around water examining how aesthetics over safety can be bad sharing perspectives on accountability and negligence this new sub is not focused on ek in the way the others have been if shes a topic as a influencer great but ive already posted about other influencers sorry to give everyone the run around but i think its important to continue this discussion as informed consumers but move away from targeted discussion you can control the discussion though

lamiche clinic review what the hell just happened just got back from visiting lamiche clinic in seoul and im reeling from the experiences wtf just happened before i get into the stories just want to explain that im no newbie to korean clinics ive spent two years researching clinics i watched every tiktok video i could find i scoured reddit and poured over the unni app last november i dipped my toe into korean clinics with a visit to ppeum in gangnam to get botox the genesis laser and ulthera and loved the experience i felt confident that i knew exactly what to expect was i in for a shock the week started off great with a visit to ppeum in myeongdong to get crows feet botox and discuss my plan for treatments the consultation was held with someone fluent in english and she gave me super informative feedback about how to plan my treatments for the week ppeum has regular monthly specials and everything is transparently priced in a binder with photos and descriptions of treatments we decided on botox i was welcomed to a back room to wash my face and get numbing cream and a few quick jabs later i was on my way back to the hotel the clinic looked lovely with plush couches a robot making me a latte and they even gave me free coins to try their claw machine i got excellent treatment and it cost me about 40 for the crows feet area i was raving to my best friend that i might prefer the nofrills factory style clinics for their efficiency and affordability im not the kind of girl who needs a private room and tea i just want a good consultation quality work and an affordable price then let me be on my way to explore korea my best friend and i saved our big treatment day at lamiche for the day before we left korea knowing we were going to look raggedy afterwards we were both invited to receive comped treatments worth up to 5000 as an influencer collaboration and i was delighted to finally try all the treatments i had been researching for years neither of us a really influencers but hey who says no to free treatments i knew i would probably make lots of content reviewing the process anyways so might as well i should have realized that the pricing wasnt going to be transparent when i emailed lamiche asking for their pricing and i got a pdf without any individual pricing only packages when we approached lamiche it was a huge business with signage on three different buildings we followed the elevator up to a waiting room that appeared quite dingy and dated and i told myself not to judge a clinic by how ugly the waiting room looks when we checked into the front desk we let the staff know that we doing a collab for lamiche the staff seemed stressed and asked us to sit down a staff member came to talk to us and spent quite a long time going over our medications meticulously which seems odd because spoiler alert they prescribed us medications that were contraindicated with what we were taking and could have been dangerous another staff member came to take us to another floor and the two staff members argued with each other in korean it was stressful to say the least we were hustled from one floor to another with the note taker staff lady trailing us and continuing to ask us medication questions how many months have you been on birth control are you sure finally we got our faces washed and photos taken of our faces the whole time being hustled from room to room by the time we were sat in front of the doctor in her dingy cluttered office with an english translator we were apprehensive about what to expect they flashed our photos on the screen and the doctor asked my best friend what she wanted improved elasticity she squeaked have you considered botox the translator said sure sounds good and that was the end of that conversation i pointed out things i wanted improved and let the doctor know what treatments i was getting at home like hydroquinone 2 topical for melasma and a regular series of microneedling for acne scars she nodded then to our total surprise we were hustled back out to the waiting room the total time with the doctor was under five minutes we both sat in the waiting room trying to understand what was going on while the note taker was still asking about our medications how do you spell spironolactone finally another staff member came to take us to the treatment area for the face numbing cream before we start we would like to talk to the doctor first about what treatments she suggests but you just talked to the doctor she didnt tell us what treatments we will receive the staff member beckoned another staff person over and they argued in korean in front of us then turned at us and said come to the treatment area and someone will tell you what treatments you will receive no i said we dont want any treatments until we can discuss them with the doctor why i was hoping to get sculptra or in mode fx today and i want to ask the doctor if im the right candidate for that no problem we will write that on a paper and ask the doctor for you my best friend looked at me with a panicked look in her eyes we politely argued with the staff back and forth and finally they said look we have a very busy day and the doctor isnt available you will have to wait a long time just come to the treatment area and someone will tell you what treatments youll be getting begrudgingly we were hustled to separate rooms before they separated us i grabbed my besties hand and told her once they tell you your treatment plan ask to speak to the doctor we were led to small dark rooms with wheeled beds all facing a curtained epicenter with multitudes of laser machines and clinical staff hurrying around i laid down on the bed with a questionable floral blanket and someone pulled open the curtain at the head of the bed applied numbing cream with a spatula wiped it off with a tissue and put it back on the wallmounted holder and disappeared as quickly as they appeared i happened to notice a tiny note taped to the wall among various medical paraphernalia and signage that said if you are experiencing pain you can request these options more numbing cream local anesthetic shots a muscle numbing shot or laughing gas i made a mental note to request the local anesthetic which ended up saving me a sales rep entered the room with a stapled paper this is the treatment the doctor recommends ultherapy sculptra in mode fx botox to lift the corners of your mouth and bbl laser i was beginning to realize that there was no pricing mentioned for any of these treatments and there wouldnt be a backandforth discussion of what could get me the best results for the 5000 value id like to discuss this with the doctor i said you already talked to the doctor but i didnt get to talk about treatments with the doctor i understand that sculptra can be applied to the upper or lower face i want to ask the doctor which is better for me no problem when someone comes to do your treatment they will decide on the best place for sculptra but for ultherapy i said im concerned that it can get rid of facial fat did they doctor say where to apply ultherapy no problem the person to apply your treatment will know the good place at this point i grew more firm and made it clear that i would not be getting any treatments until i spoke with a doctor about the treatment plan the translator seemed over dealing with me but a doctor popped out from behind the curtain within five minutes i recognized his face from the magazine covers in the waiting room and realized he was the head doctor at the clinic so who was i talking to in the consultation room was that original doctor getting any of the messages relayed through the translator i explained that id like to treat acne scars during my visit too i was wisening up to the fact that their pricing and packages are loosey goosey so i wanted that concern addressed even if it wasnt my 1 concern i had read some peerreviewed studies that showed subscision using a needle to scrape the adhesions under the scar combined with c02 laser improved acne scars more than any other treatments so i asked for co2 and subcision the doctor suggested a different laser and i asked why it was better than the combination of co2 and subcision instead of giving me an answer he agreed to co2 and subcision then i asked about sculptra and the doctor grabbed my hand put a mirror in it and wrapped his fingers over mine holding the mirror up to my face a bit aggressively i was startled by this but chalked it up to a cultural difference perhaps hes just in a rush and that works more efficiently than asking me to hold a mirror you have more more volume on one side of your face than the other he said and gosh darn he was 100 right no sculptra for you it will make your face too big better to shrink your face with ultherapy and thermage would it balance my face to put sculptra on the side without volume i asked the doctor shrugged ok is it possible to also get botox in my forehead i asked no you must pay for forehead botox not included i couldnt believe that botox which is so cheap in korea was the threshold of their package and not the co2 or sculptra but i was pushing my luck so i didnt mind it i thanked the doctor profusely for his time and he disappeared back behind the curtain i haggled with the translator to let me go find my bestie in her little room to help her with her treatment plan and when i found her she looked terrified she was holding the treatment plan paper while the sales rep talked at her and bestie looked like she was about to flee i reviewed her treatment plan and talked her through each one sculptra thermage bbl laser genesis laser and botox this is a fairly moderate approach not a lot of risks to be concerned about sculptra can cause some scar tissue formation just like any needle can when it pierces the skin which some say can be a concern if you want a face lift in the future other plastic surgeons say that a quality surgeon will know how to handle sculptra faces and it shouldnt be an issue she nodded nervously thermage will hurt but its over in ten minutes youre a tough girl you got this ask for the local anesthetic injection okay and when the doctors pop out of the curtain to do the treatments make sure you tell each one that you have work on monday so they need to go easy i went back to my room someone popped out of the curtain to inject my face with local anesthetic in 68 places which probably hurt the most you can feel it deep in the bone from there the next two hours were a dizzying blur of the curtain opening and closing and a rotating array of different doctors doing treatments me literally in the dark with a gauze taped over my eyes they started with thermage but i didnt even know what treatment they were doing and later i noticed in my recorded video that they applied it on my cheeks i really hope that it doesnt create fat loss in my cheeks something i would have wanted to go over with the doctor oh well the thermage ulthera and in mode fx was completely manageable with the local anesthetic shots it felt like a gentle warmth and light pinching about 10 of my face wasnt completely numb and i certainly felt the pain then comparable to a splinter or bee sting or burning my neck with a curling iron but the pain is very short and then theyre right back to the numb parts of my face i found that with deep breaths and tapping my fingerspinching my finger tips to distract my brain from the pain it was actually easy i asked each doctor with a translation app what treatment was next and it helped enormously to know what was causing the pain and remind myself in my head how the treatment works meanwhile in another room my bestie was having panic attacks as they went at her with unexplained treatments not knowing what was what and why it hurts at one point i asked to sneak away to her room for a few minutes and held her hands while they finished her treatments talking her through the anxiety she told me later that if i hadnt shown up she would have walked out midtreatment from the anxiety of it all next a young doctor approached me with a big needle this is the fat dissolving injection for your double chin i didnt recall seeing that on my treatment plan reread it later and sure enough it was there in the list but i thought to myself you know what hell yeah i could feel the acid burning for several hours but it was a warm soreness that was easy with the anesthetic the botox came after applied by the same head doctor i had thrown a polite fit to speak to he announced simply botox and squirted liquid through the needle the mist falling onto my face he jabbed my neck scalp corners of mouth forehead i guess he decided to throw forehead botox in after all and other points in my face that in all my 10 years of botox no other injector has ever injected each time misting my face with botox liquid that he squirted out before each jab i closed my eyes and wondered to myself if neurotoxin is safe for eyes i forgot to check the needle and see if it was unopenedreal botox but at this point i was in a haze the sculptra was last and it was painless with the anesthetic i swear i could hear the adhesions popping loose under my skin as the needle swirled around under my cheek then i was given verbal recovery instructions which i had the good sense to immediately write down in my phone before i forgot and was scooted out to the waiting room we were told to get our prescription on a different floor and again there was more stressful interactions with the staff trying to figure out where we were supposed to be all the staff seemed irritatedstressedconfused each time we spoke to them and we wondered if they havent fully streamlined their foreign process or if this is just a cultural difference in customer service for being a collab based on a review we were surprised to be treated like we were a surprise nuisance they gave my bestie an influencer gift but not me and we joked that it was because i argued too much they slapped a chin sling on us and we found ourselves holding a prescription at their preferred pharmacy across the street this is where things get really weird i was prescribed isotretinoin accutane oral transexamic acid keeps pigment from reforming hydroquinone cream fades melasma and tretinoin improves cellular turnovertexture the total cost was 120 for all the prescriptions back at our hotel i noticed the prescription note said not recommended to take transexamic acid trx while on birth control upon further googling i found out that oral trx mixed with birth control greatly increases the risk of blood clots so much so that its considered unethical to even test this on women considering we were also going on a 14 hour fight the next day that combo could have been seriously dangerous and even lifethreatening and nothing was said to me about this even after they had meticulously logged my medications also odd i had told them that im taking prescription hydroquinine cream for melasma that contains the topical form of trx and tretinoin all three medications that they double prescribed me and i paid 120 for at their pharmacy its obvious my medication history wasnt taken into account at all finally if anyone reading this has taken isotretinoin accutane you know that medication has a 30day waiting period a medical online quiz and two pregnancy tests before you can even get your hands on it along with continuous liver testing to make sure you arent one of the 15 who gets liver abnormalities its worth the effort because it causes absolute radiant skin forget pregnancy glow accutane glow is unmatched so why is lamiche prescribing both me and my bestie a 60 day course of accutane when we dont have any acne is it to create a quick glow and glass skin effects that will last as long as the accutane does that we attribute to the clinics treatments im truly puzzled even if drugs are controlled differently in korea where was our medication consultation my best guess is that they just want to do the most to guarantee results from the inside out but accutane is a pretty aggressive approach to glass skin one that a patient should have some input on all in all im healing up nicely and ill report back 36 months from now once the results are visible in summary pricing it seems like the lamiche approach is that they bundle together whatever they think will give you the best results and there isnt any transparency about individual pricing im not sure they even know their own pricing for individual treatments they are pretty loosey goosey with it if you want something you can certainly negotiate for it expect to spend at least 3000 for their bundled treatments this might be an affordable option if youre doing a whole list of treatments but good luck getting a quote consultation lamiche will hear out your skin concerns and then tell you what treatments youre getting no room for back and forth i cant say that their treatment plan was wrong i would have wanted the same thing for myself to their credit they didnt push any highrisk treatments like threads or filler and they didnt recommend any treatments that require more than one session to be noticeable just make sure that you speak up about every single concern in the initial consultation because if you request a treatment later someone will have to hunt down a doctor if i could do it over again i would have written a list of treatments to hand to the doctor in that initial consultation and said what do you think will give me the best results in one session if youre wanting indepth education about how the treatments work that doesnt happen here if youre curious one like me you must come prepared with your own research and ready to ask for exactly what treatments you want otherwise trust their process if you offer your input on how you want to structure your bundle you will get a little push back but if you advocate for yourself they will accept it service if youre accustomed to american customer service you will need to toughen up at lamiche one staff member told me you dont need to freak out youll have the chance to talk to a doctor when he does your treatments i dont think she knows how freak out translates to be condescending theres a cultural barrier and a language barrier and you wont get received with tea and smiles its a huge clinic and people look stressed because they are stressed work culture in korea is insane the right person for lamiche all in all i think lamiche might be the right fit for someone with a 3000 budget who wants a oneday transformation without having to research treatments who can just show up and let them throw every treatment in the mix and go home with a new face as long as you get the local anesthetic injections double check your meds with google and hug a teddy bear youll be finea bit shellshocked but fine overall id recommend that beginners start with a clinic like ppeum where you have transparent pricing in the binder with all the information about treatments pick one treatment to dip your toes in spend about 100300 go home and enjoy watching the results slowly reveal ppeum has a beautiful clinic space and they have a more streamlined process for foreigners you wont feel quite as lost or hustled even being a factory clinic and if the results arent exactly what you expected you only spent 300 not 3000 in conclusion i plan on being postive but honest in my collab video with lamiche as long as koreas strict defamation laws allow me ive noticed that a lot of the videos about lamiche clinic i trusted are clearly influencer content and im not sure if anyone else had a similar experience to me but its certainly not what i expected i dont think ill return to lamiche because my favorite part of the clinic visits are the consultations where i can learn more about the treatments that are so fascinating to me and if im paying my own money i need to feel 100 confident in the treatment plan giving me the best value

looking back on him detaching haunts me i always thought i was a straight up ap but now see i have fa traits i tested him closed myself off sometimes but not in the same the way he did he loved harder than me and stonewalled when hurt he started to withdraw and i just thought he needed space i should have asked more questions i got anxious and would get irritable and needy up demands in a bid to connect he needed holding quietly and i pushed him away then one day i shut down during an argument not silence but no affection or chat until the next day he spiralled and a week later made the decision to break up its been 5 weeks ive reflected deeply and learned so much should i reach out i believe he has no idea about attachment theory but is willing to explore how his past traumas have informed his relationships now

mary shelleypercy shelley byron oh my delete if not allowed but i feel this post straddles the worlds of literary people and people here for the film gdt intentionally obviously used these percy shelley byron quotes to further his thematic exploration of masculine violence the discourse on forgiveness of monsters who are but mere men at worse some of whom are fathers i see this film as a thematic exploration of not just mary shelleys frankenstein the book but also a thematic exploration of the legacy surrounding the bookincluding other interpretations of the work and of the lore surrounding percy byron i am sure there are scholars of percy and byron who can speak more to how those men have been painted throughout history and storytelling as varying degrees of imperfect but these quotes i think were meant to further invoke masculine figures who have been cast as villains in mary shelleys life maybe that is true they were horrible at times and this is not just a story but these are the questions the film invokes what do we do with the legacies of men who can be violent or who are in other ways deeply flawed as a feminist scholar of many years myself i have found the discourse in response to these quotes has been really interesting i know that many feminist scholars interpret the creature in the film as a figure who is meant to be both grotesque and sympathetic however some of the response to these quotes suggests the current wave of feminism is not primed to talk about masculinity and patriarchy as a forces that also harm men i think this is something many feminists will acknowledge in theory but in practice have a harder time fully humanizing real living men in response to this film but i do see a lot of ogling at how hot jacob elordi looks as a reanimated quilt of human corpses it all makes sense to me given how much dehumanizing sexualization women face constantly so i get that real men have set the bar so unbelievably low but if we can humanize the creature or frankenstein the evil dr we can humanize our husbands brothers fathers who had their emotional intelligence literally beaten out of them or deprogrammed through decades of harmful media politics intergenerational cycles of violence and harm among men are a theme of gdts take on not just the book his personal interpretation but also on the legacy of frankenstein as a cultural phenomenon in my experience feminists explore the theme of breaking cycles of masculine violence a lot it seems like fair game for gdt to explore this theme too since he seems to have first hand experience of masculine violence a question i ask to other feminists in this discourse are we ready to allow men to take up space in conversations about breaking cycles of masculine violence what if there is a larger role for the agency of men in discourses about dismantling patriarchy and to be clear this is not an argument for forgiving men who have been serious perpetuators of violence esp acts of gendered or sexual violence but what if the feelings that swirls for us when we watch this film and see these quotes are meant to make us more compassionate toward all living things yes even men and to elizabeths character bugs we surely are not meant to watch this become enraged at someone for being a man and interpreting art like one and then use it as further reason to hate someone different than us

how to create a home wine bar that transforms your entertaining theres something special about a wellappointed home wine bar its more than just a place to store bottles its a social hub a conversation starter and a signal to your guests that youre ready to relax and enjoy good company it turns a simple gettogether into an experience but the idea of creating one can feel a bit overwhelming do you need a dedicated room expensive equipment a sommeliers knowledge of vintages not at all the truth is an incredible home wine bar is less about a big budget and more about smart thoughtful choices its about creating a functional and beautiful spot that invites you and your guests to linger a little longer lets break down how to build one from the ground up why bother with a dedicated home wine bar before we get into the how lets talk about the why investing a little time into a dedicated wine space pays off in big ways it elevates your hosting game youre no longer fumbling for a corkscrew or hunting for clean glasses everything you need is in one place making you look like a graceful prepared host it encourages exploration when your wines are on display and accessible youre more likely to try new things and share your discoveries with friends it creates a focal point even in a small space a wellstyled wine bar can serve as a beautiful design element that adds character and warmth click here to check the product on amazon finding the perfect spot location is everything your wine bar doesnt need its own zip code the best location is one thats convenient for both you and your guests consider these common areas the kitchen often the most natural choice especially if you have a counter or nook to spare its convenient for pairing wine with food the dining room perfect for formal dinners a buffet or console table here can double as a serving station and wine bar the living room a bar cart or a small table in a corner can create a cozy loungelike feel perfect for casual sipping and conversation wherever you choose just keep two things in mind try to avoid direct sunlight which can damage wine and make sure theres enough space for people to gather around without blocking traffic the foundation choosing your furniture this is where the vision starts to take shape you dont need anything fancyjust a surface and some storage here are a few popular options 1 the wine bar cart the champion of flexibility you can wheel it out for parties and tuck it away when you need more floor space look for one with multiple shelves for bottles a sturdy top for a corkscrew and glassware and maybe even a builtin rack for hanging stemware 2 the console or sideboard table this offers a more permanent builtin feel it provides a great surface for pouring and ample storage below for bottles tools and extras like a decanter or cheese board 3 the repurposed piece dont underestimate a sturdy old bookshelf or a vintage cabinet with a little creativity maybe a coat of paint or some new hardware you can create a oneofakind wine station full of character click here to check the product on amazon the essentials what your wine bar actually needs once you have your spot and your furniture its time to stock it with the right gear think of it as a toolkit for great wine experiences wine storage how you store your wine matters a simple rack is fine for shortterm storage but if you want to get serious temperature control is key wine is a living thing storing it in a standard kitchen fridge is too cold and dry while leaving it on the counter in a warm room can age it prematurely the goal is a stable cool temperature around 55f this is where a small piece of equipment can make a world of difference if you find yourself buying nicer bottles or just want to ensure every glass is served at its absolute best the one thing i wish id found sooner is a quality thermoelectric wine cooler unlike a regular fridge it maintains a gentle vibrationfree environment thats perfect for aging and preserving the delicate flavors of your wine it sits right on your counter keeps your favorite bottles at the perfect temperature and completely removes the guesswork click here to check the product on amazon glassware you dont need a dozen different types of glasses but having the right ones makes a noticeable difference if youre starting out stick to the basics allpurpose red wine glasses a slightly larger bowl is perfect for bold reds allpurpose white wine glasses a smaller more ushaped bowl helps maintain the cooler temperature and crisp aromas of white wines getting a set of six of each is a fantastic starting point for most home entertaining the musthave toolkit no wine bar is complete without the basic accessories heres your nonnegotiable checklist a highquality waiters friend corkscrew the kind with the small knife and lever is a classic for a reason a set of good wine bottle stoppers for preserving leftovers a decanter which is especially great for letting bold red wines breathe before serving stocking your bar beyond the bottle an empty bar is just a piece of furniture heres a simple formula for keeping it guestready without breaking the bank click here to check the product on amazon the crowdpleaser red a reliable merlot cabernet sauvignon or malbec the crisp white a versatile sauvignon blanc or pinot grigio the easydrinker a dry ros is almost always a hit something bubbly a prosecco or cava is great for toasts and adds a festive touch and dont forget the snacks a small bowl of mixed nuts some good quality olives and a block of a hard cheese like aged cheddar or parmesan with a few crackers are all you need to turn your wine bar into a fullblown tasting experience the finishing touches making it yours this is where you add personality a home wine bar should reflect your style add a light a small table lamp with a warm bulb can create an incredibly inviting glow go green a small lowmaintenance plant like a succulent or snake plant adds life and color include art a small framed print or even a cool quirky sign can make the space feel complete and uniquely yours creating a home wine bar is a journey not a destination start with the essentials build your collection over time and most importantly have fun with it its your personal corner of the world dedicated to one of lifes greatest simple pleasures cheers to that

driving towards thermodynamic efficiency a transition from structure to information in the emergence of biology and consciousness the following is a commentary on the bifurcation mechanisms underlying the process of dissipative adaptation in response to selection pressures specifically i draw on the similar conclusions made in a drive towards thermodynamic efficiency for dissipative structures in chemical reaction networks and a dynamic bifurcation mechanism explains cortexwide neural correlates of conscious access wherein a transition from structural to informational selforganization naturally arises in hierarchies of nested dissipative networks from this i imply that the transition from the physical to the biological may follow an equivalent mechanism as the transition from the biological to the conscious where informational selforganization is entirely dependent on the hierarchical reference frame the conscious is the information of the neural the neural is the information of the biological and the biological is the information of the physical contrary to thestill widely heldbelief that life is a struggle against the second law of thermodynamics recent advances in nonequilibrium thermodynamics successfully recast biological systems as a subclass of dissipative structures the formation of such dissipative structures is statistically favoured by generalizations of the second law of thermodynamics because their existence enables the dissipation of reservoirs of free energy which could not be accessed otherwise dissipative structure formation has been well understood for many systems in the nearequilibrium linearresponse regime due to the work of prigogine and colleagues in the 1960s and 1970s 9 leading to the notion of biological systems as a class of selforganising free energyconversion engines 10 however it took several decades until thermodynamic equalities were derived that hold for small systems arbitrarily far from equilibrium one important difference between life and nonlife is the role of information processing in the ongoing physical processes 171819 although simple dissipative systems such as convection cells are governed by thermodynamic constraints and fluxes flowing through them living systems contain large amounts of information eg stored in a cells dna and epigenome whichin stark contrast to simpler systemsgovern and structure the thermodynamic fluxes through them what kind of drives or pressures could facilitate the transition from a simple thermodynamic to an informationgoverned regime in dissipative systems two lines of work show that thermodynamic efficiency might play a role in this transition in stochastic thermodynamics the dissipated heat in a thermodynamic system which is driven by a timevarying potential upper bounds the systems nonpredictive information about the timedependent drive 20 thus to minimize the dissipated heat during the work extraction process the system must develop an efficient predictive representation of the driving environmental dynamics we first demonstrate a simple mechanism that leads to selfselection of efficient dissipative structures in a stochastic chemical reaction network when the dissipated driving chemical potential difference is decreased we then discuss how such a drive can emerge naturally in a hierarchy of selfsimilar dissipative structures each feeding on the dissipative structures of a previous level when moving away from the initial driving disequilibrium although the study of dissipative structures has allowed for a great deal of progress in understanding the emergence of biology from physics the gap between normal dissipative structures and biological life is still just as wide as the gap between biological life and consciousness itself analyzing the depth of the relevant selforganizing hierarchies may provide a shared answer to the emergence of both phenomena namely a shift from structural selforganization to selforganization of the phasespace itself ie informational just as a predictive genetic representation was required to overcome the thermodynamic upper bound of a physical dissipative systems timedependent drive a similar predictive mechanism conscious awareness may necessarily arise at the thermodynamic upper bound of the resulting systems neural timedependent drive as is alluded to in the excerpt more simplistic dissipative systems are understood via structurally linear dynamics while truly emergentcomplexity involves higherorder informational changes this mechanism reveals itself in the distinction that can be made between local and global bifurcations local bifurcations provide the basis for linear evolutions slight structural variations are subject to selection pressures forcing the emergence of complex structures to more efficiently dissipate free energy as each successive variation provides diminishing marginal returns there will eventually be an asymptotic approach towards this thermodynamic upper bound information temperature can be used to quantify the frequency and intensity of informational exchange which becomes negative at this thermodynamic upper bound the positivenegative shift creates a regime where energy input leads to entropy reduction ie ordering thereby expressing the hallmark of informational selforganization this transition subsequently represents a global bifurcation where the entire energyinformation relationship undergoes a qualitative shift eg via attainment of negative information temperature resulting in new attractor structures and informationdominated organization a similar developmental process can be seen in the neural correlates of consciousness laying the foundation for ignition events within conscious awareness fast ampa receptors drive global change and the corresponding conscious experience while slow local nmda receptors structurally shape and maintain those structures local selforganization slowly builds up to a globally restructuring avalanche whose new structure is then further maintained and iterated on by the local conscious access is suggested to involve ignition an allornone activation across cortical areas to elucidate this phenomenon we carry out computer simulations of a detection task using a mesoscale connectomebased model for the multiregional macaque cortex the model uncovers a dynamic bifurcation mechanism that gives rise to ignition in a network of associative regions a hierarchical nmethyldaspartate nmdaamino3hydroxy5methyl4isoxazolepropionic acid ampa receptor gradient plays a critical role fast ampa receptors drive feedforward signal propagation while slow nmda receptors in feedback pathways shape and sustain the ignited network intriguingly the model suggests higher nmdatoampa receptor ratios in sensory areas compared to association areas a prediction supported by in vitro autoradiographydata furthermore the model accounts for diverse behavioral and physiological phenomena linked to consciousness this work sheds light on how receptor gradients along the cortical hierarchy enable distributed cognitive functions and provides a biologically constrained computational framework for investigating the neurophysiological basis of conscious access while i didnt wanna get too woowooy at the beginning i believe this process holds universally and provides the foundation for a form of panpsychism while by no means agreed science classical spacetime has many times been considered as potentially emergent from quantum entanglement in the same way as each of the hierarchically nested mediums previously described entanglement can similarly be understand as a selforganizing dissipative process here we explore the principal of the dissipationdriven entanglement generation and stabilization applying the wisdom of dissipative structure theory to the quantum world the open quantum system eventually evolves to the least dissipation state via unsupervised quantum selforganization and entanglement emerges
